intro: Tripterella bicolor, commonly known as the purple tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers with purple veins and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Tripterella bicolor is valued for its ornamental beauty and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
